intro: Galium peloponnesiacum, commonly known as the Peloponnesian bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its fruits are small, dry capsules. Galium peloponnesiacum is a low-growing perennial that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native environment.
